title: Frankolala
author: Frankolala
content: I welcome myself and other newbies in this forum.As a newbie,I am using this opportunity to welcome you to this forum. You must have been told about this forum Bitcointalk by someone close to you or you searched for it online and that is why you have registered to be part of this forum.   This is the only legit platform that you can learn/teach bit coin based on your contributions on topics been discussed in each forum. You can get merits when you post quality posts and good comment on topics discussed on the board.   This forum will update you about what is happening in the world and also teach you so many things you don't know in our present day.This forum will make you willing to learn and to be a good writer,the best of all it will teach and expose you on everything you need to know on cryptocurrency/bit coin and other things,so you can see there are lots of benefits from this forum.   The number the number of merit and activities you have received through your comments and posts upgrades you to the next rank. I wish you all the best in this forum but you need to be active and committed. You can can always learn from beginners/help board page and also other boards where your interest is.   For more information you can check  https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1689727.0     Thanks

comments.author: Daniel91
comments.body: Quote from: Frankolala on July 30, 2022, 09:38:28 AM   I welcome myself and other newbies in this forum.As a newbie,I am using this opportunity to welcome you to this forum. You must have been told about this forum Bitcointalk by someone close to you or you searched for it online and that is why you have registered to be part of this forum.   This is the only legit platform that you can learn/teach bit coin based on your contributions on topics been discussed in each forum. You can get merits when you post quality posts and good comment on topics discussed on the board.   This forum will update you about what is happening in the world and also teach you so many things you don't know in our present day.This forum will make you willing to learn and to be a good writer,the best of all it will teach and expose you on everything you need to know on cryptocurrency/bit coin and other things,so you can see there are lots of benefits from this forum.   The number the number of merit and activities you have received through your comments and posts upgrades you to the next rank. I wish you all the best in this forum but you need to be active and committed. You can can always learn from beginners/help board page and also other boards where your interest is.   For more information you can check  https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1689727.0     ThanksHaven't you had a similar topic in this forum section recently?  This forum was the first online place to discuss Bitcoin, 13 years ago, started by Satoshi, the creator of Bitcoin.However, a lot of time has passed and today there are many other legitimate places on the Internet to discuss crypto and this forum is no longer an exclusive place for crypto discussions.After all, today's young people use other ways of online communication much more, such as Telegram groups, social networks etc.

comments.author: Shamm
comments.body: Quote from: Frankolala on July 30, 2022, 09:38:28 AM   I welcome myself and other newbies in this forum.As a newbie,I am using this opportunity to welcome you to this forum. You must have been told about this forum Bitcointalk by someone close to you or you searched for it online and that is why you have registered to be part of this forum.   This is the only legit platform that you can learn/teach bit coin based on your contributions on topics been discussed in each forum. You can get merits when you post quality posts and good comment on topics discussed on the board.   This forum will update you about what is happening in the world and also teach you so many things you don't know in our present day.This forum will make you willing to learn and to be a good writer,the best of all it will teach and expose you on everything you need to know on cryptocurrency/bit coin and other things,so you can see there are lots of benefits from this forum.   The number the number of merit and activities you have received through your comments and posts upgrades you to the next rank. I wish you all the best in this forum but you need to be active and committed. You can can always learn from beginners/help board page and also other boards where your interest is.   For more information you can check  https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1689727.0     ThanksEven though you are registered way back May 2, 2022 sand you are 2 months old here in the forum still I say welcome to the forum, yes you are right that through this forum many newbies can gain knowledge about bitcoin or related cryptocurrencies and like what Daniel91 said nowadays many sites that can we talk about cryptocurrencies but for me still this forum is the best when you are trying to learn about crypto.

comments.author: Mate2237
comments.body: Quote from: Daniel91 on July 30, 2022, 01:43:34 PM_ today there are many other legitimate places on the Internet to discuss crypto and this forum is no longer an exclusive place for crypto discussions.As for me I only know bitcointalk, so if I may ask, can you please provide those legit sites for confirmation?OP you are welcome to the forum. Learning is a rigorous process as far as you follow up the forum rules then you are good to go. There is time for everything. All newbies plus me are also welcome.

comments.author: Daniel91
comments.body: Quote from: Mate2237 on July 30, 2022, 02:27:00 PMQuote from: Daniel91 on July 30, 2022, 01:43:34 PM_ today there are many other legitimate places on the Internet to discuss crypto and this forum is no longer an exclusive place for crypto discussions.As for me I only know bitcointalk, so if I may ask, can you please provide those legit sites for confirmation?OP you are welcome to the forum. Learning is a rigorous process as far as you follow up the forum rules then you are good to go. There is time for everything. All newbies plus me are also welcome.I actually follow some local Telegram and FB groups in the Croatian language, so that wouldn't help you much.As for crypto forums, I only follow this forum because it is still the most relevant place for crypto information and discussions.What I really wanted to say is that the younger generations no longer follow Internet forums and prefer different crypto groups on social networks and Telegram, and for a long time there has been a decline in activity on this forum. I think that this trend will continue because this way of communication is clearly not interesting and attractive enough for younger generations.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Quote from: Mate2237 on July 30, 2022, 02:27:00 PMAs for me I only know bitcointalk, so if I may ask, can you please provide those legit sites for confirmation?Not necessarily sites, but communities. One of the biggest being Reddit's r/bitcoin and r/cryptocurrency subreddits, then crypto Twitter. Bitcointalk is the only relevant forum-style community that has decent activity as far as I know.

comments.author: Gozie51
comments.body: Op you made your thread more meaningful by dropping that link in your post and through clicking that link, every other information that is needed would be found through reading threads in the sub links. I also agree that this forum is the most useful if not the only trusted forum that you learn and earn, it community based crypto discussion is very resourceful as you journey into the world of bitcoin and cryptocurrency.

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: Quote from: Daniel91 on July 30, 2022, 01:43:34 PMHaven't you had a similar topic in this forum section recently?  This forum was the first online place to discuss Bitcoin, 13 years ago, started by Satoshi, the creator of Bitcoin.However, a lot of time has passed and today there are many other legitimate places on the Internet to discuss crypto and this forum is no longer an exclusive place for crypto discussions.After all, today's young people use other ways of online communication much more, such as Telegram groups, social networks etc. Quote from: Daniel91 on July 30, 2022, 03:05:38 PMQuote from: Mate2237 on July 30, 2022, 02:27:00 PMQuote from: Daniel91 on July 30, 2022, 01:43:34 PM_ today there are many other legitimate places on the Internet to discuss crypto and this forum is no longer an exclusive place for crypto discussions.As for me I only know bitcointalk, so if I may ask, can you please provide those legit sites for confirmation?OP you are welcome to the forum. Learning is a rigorous process as far as you follow up the forum rules then you are good to go. There is time for everything. All newbies plus me are also welcome.I actually follow some local Telegram and FB groups in the Croatian language, so that wouldn't help you much.As for crypto forums, I only follow this forum because it is still the most relevant place for crypto information and discussions.What I really wanted to say is that the younger generations no longer follow Internet forums and prefer different crypto groups on social networks and Telegram, and for a long time there has been a decline in activity on this forum. I think that this trend will continue because this way of communication is clearly not interesting and attractive enough for younger generations. Then what are you trying to say? You confused yourself. Look at the statements you made that I bolded it. You said, there are legitimate sites to discuss bitcoin and other crypto currencies and Mate2237 asked you to provide those site and you are saying that they are from your local telegram and facebook group. Are you for real?  You would have made it clear from your first post. Because other users are also waiting to see the sites you would have provided. Please If you are to educate newbies, give them the legit information so they can grow up with it and pass to generation. When you say other legitimate sites, that means, other forums or platforms that look like bitcointalk not telegram or facebook groups for specific purpose.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: Frankolala on July 30, 2022, 09:38:28 AMThis forum will update you about what is happening in the world and also teach you so many things you don't know in our present day.Yes including the scam attempt way of some users on how to steal or rob money from you in a completely subtle way. Yes forum is the home of learning and it doesnt end on how knowledgeable we can be off due to its importance and guidelines. However there are always an outlier to this norm which we could also learn like ways on how to avoid scam which other forums are lacking to emphasize. Avoiding it is being teach here which all users can benefited well.

comments.author: Daniel91
comments.created_time: July 30, 2022, 05:00:56 PMLast edit: July 30, 2022, 05:14:53 PM by Daniel91
comments.body: Quote from: Agbe on July 30, 2022, 03:42:12 PMQuote from: Daniel91 on July 30, 2022, 01:43:34 PMHaven't you had a similar topic in this forum section recently?  This forum was the first online place to discuss Bitcoin, 13 years ago, started by Satoshi, the creator of Bitcoin.However, a lot of time has passed and today there are many other legitimate places on the Internet to discuss crypto and this forum is no longer an exclusive place for crypto discussions.After all, today's young people use other ways of online communication much more, such as Telegram groups, social networks etc. Quote from: Daniel91 on July 30, 2022, 03:05:38 PMQuote from: Mate2237 on July 30, 2022, 02:27:00 PMQuote from: Daniel91 on July 30, 2022, 01:43:34 PM_ today there are many other legitimate places on the Internet to discuss crypto and this forum is no longer an exclusive place for crypto discussions.As for me I only know bitcointalk, so if I may ask, can you please provide those legit sites for confirmation?OP you are welcome to the forum. Learning is a rigorous process as far as you follow up the forum rules then you are good to go. There is time for everything. All newbies plus me are also welcome.I actually follow some local Telegram and FB groups in the Croatian language, so that wouldn't help you much.As for crypto forums, I only follow this forum because it is still the most relevant place for crypto information and discussions.What I really wanted to say is that the younger generations no longer follow Internet forums and prefer different crypto groups on social networks and Telegram, and for a long time there has been a decline in activity on this forum. I think that this trend will continue because this way of communication is clearly not interesting and attractive enough for younger generations. Then what are you trying to say? You confused yourself. Look at the statements you made that I bolded it. You said, there are legitimate sites to discuss bitcoin and other crypto currencies and Mate2237 asked you to provide those site and you are saying that they are from your local telegram and facebook group. Are you for real?  You would have made it clear from your first post. Because other users are also waiting to see the sites you would have provided. Please If you are to educate newbies, give them the legit information so they can grow up with it and pass to generation. When you say other legitimate sites, that means, other forums or platforms that look like bitcointalk not telegram or facebook groups for specific purpose. I think the only one confused here is actually you.I never said that there are other crypto forums that I would recommend to new members, but other places on the internet with legitimate information. It is a general statement in response to the previously stated claim.This is generally known information anyway, but it is better to be recommended by people who use other sites on a daily basis. It makes no sense to claim that this forum is the only legitimate place on the Internet to learn about crypto. In fact, mk4 already mentioned other legit crypto sites in English and I have nothing else to add. I don't see the need for overreactions.I never make recommendations lightly, without careful thought and fact-checking.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: Mate2237 on July 30, 2022, 02:27:00 PMAs for me I only know bitcointalk, so if I may ask, can you please provide those legit sites for confirmation?Some sites have already been recommended and there are still many more available out there.The forum also has a community on discord and an official Twitter account, although the later is not active.This shows however that there are credible profiles across various platforms which makes for quality discussions, just the same way there are scams, trolls etc on all platforms (bitcointalk inclusive). You just need to filter what you listen to.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Quote from: Upgrade00 on July 30, 2022, 06:11:40 PMSome sites have already been recommended and there are still many more available out there.The forum also has a community on discord and an official Twitter account, although the later is not active.A little extra add from me about some great places for the bitcoin community. I think you can take a look at the list from these available sources: https://bitcoin.org/en/communityFrom the sources above I can say that bitcointalk.org is a great site for the community. Here we are not only talking about ideas, developments, trading, wallets but there are many other things that can also be discussed including politics, law and legality and this is perfect for beginners who are improving their knowledge.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Are you getting re-baptized lol. Take a look at you activity mate, you don’t need to be re-welcomed. Also you should have learnt a good yard by now to even have such post in your tank. I have advised so newbies on this matter and that is if at the time you don’t have any knowledgeable post to bring in and you feel urged or pressed to do so take that energy in researching. You would be building you mind rather than messing up you account.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Quote from: Agbe on July 30, 2022, 03:42:12 PMThen what are you trying to say? You confused yourself. Look at the statements you made that I bolded it. You said, there are legitimate sites to discuss bitcoin and other crypto currencies and Mate2237 asked you to provide those site and you are saying that they are from your local telegram and facebook group. Are you for real?  Tbh, Daniel91 said "there are", he didn't say "I would recommend", so both of his answers are legit. Also, your tone was a bit snarky, which isn't nice to a senior member who has probably contributed more to this community than you ever will. Learn some manners.Quote from: Agbe on July 30, 2022, 03:42:12 PMYou would have made it clear from your first post. Because other users are also waiting to see the sites you would have provided. Please If you are to educate newbies, give them the legit information so they can grow up with it and pass to generation. When you say other legitimate sites, that means, other forums or platforms that look like bitcointalk not telegram or facebook groups for specific purpose. In the post literally two posts above yours, mk4 mentions some of the "other forums or platforms" you could consider. And, if you need more information, you can ask nicely instead of acting like an asshole.

comments.author: Viscore
comments.body: Quote from: Gozie51 on July 30, 2022, 03:31:00 PMOp you made your thread more meaningful by dropping that link in your post and through clicking that link, every other information that is needed would be found through reading threads in the sub links. I also agree that this forum is the most useful if not the only trusted forum that you learn and earn, it community based crypto discussion is very resourceful as you journey into the world of bitcoin and cryptocurrency. All newbies will definitely learn much even from this forum alone because this is just all about facts and shared information by most who have great experiences in the forum, and being biased is not possible here. Although there are a lot of resources existing nowadays to learn about crypto, but it has proven that this forum is still the most reliable and trusted source of legit information.

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: Quote from: Frankolala on July 30, 2022, 09:38:28 AM I welcome myself and other newbies in this forum.Let me assume you as a newbie nothing much expected from you to post as the experienced members but let me give you this as a take home, the more you grow the more the expectations required from you, meaning you can't be growing or ranking up and yet post like a newbie, to him who much is given much is expected, also i think your welcome note has nothing to benefit any newbie because all has been done much better here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5036308.0

comments.author: Agbe
comments.body: Quote from: Daniel91 on July 30, 2022, 05:00:56 PM(---)I am sorry if I sounded offensive, just that I was expected you to provide the sites or the communities based on it that I am really here to learned and what you provided were local and FB. And that was not I was expecting you.  I am really sorry. We are one. No argument. I am still your boy. Just a misunderstanding.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: Frankolala on July 30, 2022, 09:38:28 AM   I welcome myself and other newbies in this forum.You are not a newbie anymore.The topic you linked is indeed very informative for all newbies, but did you actually read it? I urge you to follow the advice given, and from now on please refrain from opening low-value topics like these:Thanks to Bitcoin ForumHow many number of activities will a newbie get perdayFastest profitable gambling gameHow many threads can a newbie post dailyHow to know if my new topic has been posted by someone beforeYou rarely ever come back and reply to these threads, which means you are not really interested in the discussion. Instead, you open new topics one after another, probably in a desperate search to get merits, which is not in line with good forum etiquette and not a good way to introduce yourself. People will easily notice this and take it to mean that you are just trolling. Do not do this. You do not have to reply to all threads. Just please keep in mind that forum discussions have to be a good balance between reading and responding to topics.

comments.author: Oceat
comments.body: Quote from: Dunamisx on July 30, 2022, 09:29:29 PMQuote from: Frankolala on July 30, 2022, 09:38:28 AM I welcome myself and other newbies in this forum.Let me assume you as a newbie nothing much expected from you to post as the experienced members but let me give you this as a take home, the more you grow the more the expectations required from you, meaning you can't be growing or ranking up and yet post like a newbie, to him who much is given much is expected, also i think your welcome note has nothing to benefit any newbie because all has been done much better here: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5036308.0But that's not the first place newbie should be going if they want to learn more about this forum or just the basic rules because they might break some rules if they go straight posting something unrelated stuffs on that section. I agree it's a better place to learn more but there are basic and other board that has a specific topic of what the name of the board says.This B&H section would be the best and the first place they have to visit if they wanna know more about this forum. It's not just they would learn something aside from Bitcoin since it has something to offer too since we got some people who will help them to grow and guide them to their growth.

comments.author: Smartvirus
comments.body: Quote from: Shamm on July 30, 2022, 02:12:01 PMQuote from: Frankolala on July 30, 2022, 09:38:28 AM   I welcome myself and other newbies in this forum.As a newbie,I am using this opportunity to welcome you to this forum. Even though you are registered way back May 2, 2022 sand you are 2 months old here in the forum still I say welcome to the forum, It was funny seeing he title of this thread and the content on the other hand wasn't less disappointing to see someone actually thinking of welcoming all newbies. It's no surprising OP has bee attached to the forum for over 2months, has got 2merits to show for it and evn though the forum has ranked OP to Jr. Member, OP still thinks of himself or herself as a newbie. Well practically, from band new - Member rank could be regarded as newbies, even though we've got a specific noted rank as that.Anyway, I think instead of creating threads such as this @OP, you should be engaged on reading more to grasps what you forum is chiefly about and then, you could come up with some new ideas out of the limitations on the threads you encounter on the forum and also some recent developments around you, in the wilder world and breaking news as well. Still, I welcome you as a newbie!
